description: Equivalent to con- + -tort; from Middle English, borrowed from Latin contortus, past participle of contorqueō, from com- + torqueō (“twist, turn”).

verbs.description: contort (third-person singular simple present contorts, present participle contorting, simple past and past participle contorted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To twist in a violent manner.
(intransitive) To twist into or as if into a strained shape or expression.
